div.p: Hello. Welcome to DeSales University.
My name is Karen Tempinksi, and I am the Former Police Chief here at DeSales University.
On behalf the men and women of my staff, I would like to welcome you to DeSales.
We are very happy to have you here.
We are very blessed to have a very low crime rate here at DeSales University.
We have officers on 24-hours, 7 days a week.
You can contact any police officer by telephone, or in person at the Police Department
which is located at the Lawless Center.
In addition to investigative reports, officers are also concerned
about your health and well being.
We offer a variety of crime prevention services, such as self-defense classes.
We offer personal property engraving, which means if you have a laptop,
we will be happy to engrave a unique serial number onto that piece of property.
In the event it is lost or stolen, that way,
if that item is later found, we can return it to you.
If you would like a ride across campus, you are unsure about walking,
simply pick up the telephone and dial extension 1250 and an officer will be happy
to give you a ride from the classroom located in Dooling Hall to the library
or anywhere on campus free of charge.
All students are required to have a parking permit.
Getting a parking permit is very simple.
Simply bring your vehicle owner's registration card
and your student identification card to the University Police Dept.
located in Lawless.
You will be asked to fill out a simple card.
There is no parking permit fee.
You will be given a parking permit and asked to place it on the right-rear bumper
of the vehicle, or you may also place it on the right rear window of the vehicle.
All ACCESS and computer students are allowed to park in the following parking lots:
Dooling Hall, the University Center, Trexler Library,
Billera Hall gymnasium, and the Labuda Center.
Please do not park in any residence hall parking lots.
If you park in a residence hall lot, you will be issued a parking ticket.
If you receive a parking ticket, there are instructions
on the ticket on what you should do.
Please do not ignore the ticket because the fines will double.
If you have any questions, please call University Police at extension 1250,
and we'll be happy to answer any questions.
